GT.content: annihilation of a remainder, as ashes sometimes testify, can play role of memory, of offering, of sacrifice
GT.linkedContent: annihilation of a remainder, as ashes sometimes testify, can play role of memory, of offering, of sacrifice

MONL.content: [re: barred access to Arabic, Berber] “the inscription of this limit could not leave traces”: multiply symptoms of a fascination
MONL.linkedContent: [re: barred access to Arabic, Berber] “the inscription of this limit could not leave traces”: multiply symptoms of a fascination

FK.content: desert of desert: where foundation loses very trace of itself in the desert, and religion can only begin again [quasi-automatically, machine-like, spontaneously]
FK.linkedContent: desert of desert: where foundation loses very trace of itself in the desert, and religion can only begin again [quasi-automatically, machine-like, spontaneously]

FK.content: modern pragmatism liberates words from origins, archaic meanings
FK.linkedContent: modern pragmatism liberates words from origins, archaic meanings

LOBL.content: translation leaves behind an untranslated remnant, illegitimately, because it arrests the movement of the everyday possibility of literature and parasitism [see SPOM p. 135 translation causes ghost to drop into oblivion] [re: double syntax of arrêt de mort]
LOBL.linkedContent: translation leaves behind an untranslated remnant, illegitimately, because it arrests the movement of the everyday possibility of literature and parasitism [see SPOM p. 135 translation causes ghost to drop into oblivion] [re: double syntax of arrêt de mort]

LOBL.content: dream of a translation w/out remnants: a metalanguage, a guarantee
LOBL.linkedContent: dream of a translation w/out remnants: a metalanguage, a guarantee

H.content: p. anne 20 acc. Nietzsche, w/out an experience, no ear to listen ~ [annihilation of trace?] “where nothing is heard nothing is there”
H.linkedContent: p. anne 20 acc. Nietzsche, w/out an experience, no ear to listen ~ [annihilation of trace?] “where nothing is heard nothing is there”

AF.content: death drive destroys archives, anarchic, destroys its own trace, operates in silence
AF.linkedContent: death drive destroys archives, anarchic, destroys its own trace, operates in silence

AF.content: leaves no monument/document of its own > as inheritance, leaves on its erotic simulacrum (erogenous color draws mask on skin)
AF.linkedContent: leaves no monument/document of its own > as inheritance, leaves on its erotic simulacrum (erogenous color draws mask on skin)

AF.content: annihilation of memory and effacement of supplement

death drive is archive fever, not a principle, aneconomy, threatens every principality, every archontic primacy, every archival desire: its silent vocation > burn the archive, incite amnesia, ruin archive as accumulation and capitalization of memory
AF.linkedContent: death drive is archive fever, not a principle, aneconomy, threatens every principality, every archontic primacy, every archival desire: its silent vocation > burn the archive, incite amnesia, ruin archive as accumulation and capitalization of memory

AF.content: return of the repressed as triumph of life [re: Lou Andreas-Salomé’s reading in Moses], surviving of an excess of life which resists annihilation
AF.linkedContent: return of the repressed as triumph of life [re: Lou Andreas-Salomé’s reading in Moses], surviving of an excess of life which resists annihilation

AF.content: if repetition is in the heart of future to-come, so is total annihilation of death drive
AF.linkedContent: if repetition is in the heart of future to-come, so is total annihilation of death drive

SPOM.content: principle of selectivity guides & hierarchizes “spirits,” fatally excluding in turn, it will annihilate, by watching over some “en veillant (sur) ses ancetres” [dead bodies] and not others
SPOM.linkedContent: principle of selectivity guides & hierarchizes “spirits,” fatally excluding in turn, it will annihilate, by watching over some “en veillant (sur) ses ancetres” [dead bodies] and not others

HASD.content: against Wittgenstein’s imposed silence > one must not avoid speaking = it is necessary that there be a trace
HASD.linkedContent: against Wittgenstein’s imposed silence > one must not avoid speaking = it is necessary that there be a trace

HASD.content: for Dionysius, theologians who penetrate “secret infinity” leave no trace
HASD.linkedContent: for Dionysius, theologians who penetrate “secret infinity” leave no trace

MPM.content: when we know our friend to be gone forever: terrifying lucidity, in light of incinerating blaze where nothingness appears
MPM.linkedContent: when we know our friend to be gone forever: terrifying lucidity, in light of incinerating blaze where nothingness appears

MPM.content: we remain in disbelief itself, we will never believe in death or immortality
MPM.linkedContent: we remain in disbelief itself, we will never believe in death or immortality

EM.content: Nietzsche’s übermensch “burns his text and erases the traces of his steps,” a laughter bursting beyond metaphysics
EM.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s übermensch “burns his text and erases the traces of his steps,” a laughter bursting beyond metaphysics

PP.content: text “run[s] the risk of being definitively lost, who will ever know of such disappearances?”
PP.linkedContent: text “run[s] the risk of being definitively lost, who will ever know of such disappearances?”

PP.content: interpretative translation as violent as it is impotent, destroys pharmakon by forbidding access to it, leaving it untouched in its reserve
PP.linkedContent: interpretative translation as violent as it is impotent, destroys pharmakon by forbidding access to it, leaving it untouched in its reserve

PP.content: all translations into languages that are heirs to Western metaphysics produce these violent effects of analysis
PP.linkedContent: all translations into languages that are heirs to Western metaphysics produce these violent effects of analysis

VM.content: avoid the worst by vigilance that takes finitude (history) seriously: that fights light w/ light: philosopher must speak and write w/in this war of light, in which he knows he’s already engaged; the worst is night, which precedes or represses discourse
VM.linkedContent: avoid the worst by vigilance that takes finitude (history) seriously: that fights light w/ light: philosopher must speak and write w/in this war of light, in which he knows he’s already engaged; the worst is night, which precedes or represses discourse

PAS.content: if there was one [name], the signature, the anagrammatic, would lose name in infinite measure of its keeping [absolute guard], so > plus de nom (visible name might hide tout autre name)
PAS.linkedContent: if there was one [name], the signature, the anagrammatic, would lose name in infinite measure of its keeping [absolute guard], so > plus de nom (visible name might hide tout autre name)

PAS.content: I call to you to protect you against the nameless
PAS.linkedContent: I call to you to protect you against the nameless

S.content: in Der Ister, Hölderlin calls to the fire, Jetzt komme, Feuer!, fire as what comes, call for to-come > acc. Heidegger, Hölderlin, the Beseeler, has been struck by God of light, gift of spirit as incineration, cremation, almost becoming ash [MOP & annihilation of trace]
S.linkedContent: in Der Ister, Hölderlin calls to the fire, Jetzt komme, Feuer!, fire as what comes, call for to-come > acc. Heidegger, Hölderlin, the Beseeler, has been struck by God of light, gift of spirit as incineration, cremation, almost becoming ash [MOP & annihilation of trace]

SH.content: date is a witness, but one can bless date w/out knowing to “what” or for “whom” one bears witness, always possible there’ll no longer be a witness for this witness
SH.linkedContent: date is a witness, but one can bless date w/out knowing to “what” or for “whom” one bears witness, always possible there’ll no longer be a witness for this witness

SH.content: in Celan’s “Die Schleuse” “Kaddish” is lost, “a word that was looking for me,” that which opens possibility of mourning what has been lost beyond a trace [loss of mourning]
SH.linkedContent: in Celan’s “Die Schleuse” “Kaddish” is lost, “a word that was looking for me,” that which opens possibility of mourning what has been lost beyond a trace [loss of mourning]

SH.content: no worse loss than death of name (still, a date remains) > mourning, interiorization of other in Erinnerung, the preserving of other in sepulcher/epitaph, is denied us; words incinerated beyond sepulcher can return as ghosts > incinerated beyond of date, words lost w/out sepulcher
SH.linkedContent: no worse loss than death of name (still, a date remains) > mourning, interiorization of other in Erinnerung, the preserving of other in sepulcher/epitaph, is denied us; words incinerated beyond sepulcher can return as ghosts > incinerated beyond of date, words lost w/out sepulcher

FWT.content: movement toward more and more “humane” death penalties whitewashes act of killing; [E.R.] gas chambers & crematoria, all trace of living was effaced
FWT.linkedContent: movement toward more and more “humane” death penalties whitewashes act of killing; [E.R.] gas chambers & crematoria, all trace of living was effaced

DS.content: perfect crime (mimed doubly), orgasm, heights of jouissance > leave no trace, (Bataille's laughing at dying, dying of laughter), “supreme spasm” > hymen
DS.linkedContent: perfect crime (mimed doubly), orgasm, heights of jouissance > leave no trace, (Bataille's laughing at dying, dying of laughter), “supreme spasm” > hymen

OS.content: Hegel: now [point] has tremendous right (ein ungeheures Recht), it is nothing as individual Now, as I pronounce it, the proudly exclusive now dissolves, flows away, falls into dust
OS.linkedContent: Hegel: now [point] has tremendous right (ein ungeheures Recht), it is nothing as individual Now, as I pronounce it, the proudly exclusive now dissolves, flows away, falls into dust

OS.content: difference btwn Being/beings, Heidegger’s discourse of trace > if difference (is) (itself) trace (neither presence nor absence): trace of trace has disappeared in the forgetting of the difference btwn Being/beings [forgetting of Being as annihilation of trace]
OS.linkedContent: difference btwn Being/beings, Heidegger’s discourse of trace > if difference (is) (itself) trace (neither presence nor absence): trace of trace has disappeared in the forgetting of the difference btwn Being/beings [forgetting of Being as annihilation of trace]

P.content: leaving (laisser), lacing (lacer), interlacing (Geflecht) can cause a lace to disappear once in a while (effigy & fiction) [re: truth in painting, Van Gogh]
P.linkedContent: leaving (laisser), lacing (lacer), interlacing (Geflecht) can cause a lace to disappear once in a while (effigy & fiction) [re: truth in painting, Van Gogh]

ROP.content: Foucault’s wager, the end (fin) of finite man: “man would be effaced, like a face drawn in sand at the edge or limit of the sea” > trait (of face, limit) splits, becomes a limit, erasing and multiplying this limit endlessly > self-relation of limit at once erases/multiplies limit
ROP.linkedContent: Foucault’s wager, the end (fin) of finite man: “man would be effaced, like a face drawn in sand at the edge or limit of the sea” > trait (of face, limit) splits, becomes a limit, erasing and multiplying this limit endlessly > self-relation of limit at once erases/multiplies limit

GSP.content: in writing, sign can always “empty” itself, may never be reactivated, risks remaining forever closed & mute
GSP.linkedContent: in writing, sign can always “empty” itself, may never be reactivated, risks remaining forever closed & mute

PS.content: Artaud’s resistance to clinical/critical exegeses: protest itself against exemplification itself > destroy history of dualist metaphysics, render doctor/critic helpless: art w/out works, language w/out trace
PS.linkedContent: Artaud’s resistance to clinical/critical exegeses: protest itself against exemplification itself > destroy history of dualist metaphysics, render doctor/critic helpless: art w/out works, language w/out trace

FS.content: not abandon ourselves to structural formalism: must attempt emancipation, but only as a dream, emancipation is impossible unless we forget our history [contra Nietzsche?]
FS.linkedContent: not abandon ourselves to structural formalism: must attempt emancipation, but only as a dream, emancipation is impossible unless we forget our history [contra Nietzsche?]

DIF.content: forgetting of ontological difference: disappearance of trace of trace > Heidegger: even the early trace (die frühe Spur) is obliterated when presence is in the position of the highest
DIF.linkedContent: forgetting of ontological difference: disappearance of trace of trace > Heidegger: even the early trace (die frühe Spur) is obliterated when presence is in the position of the highest

O.content: acc. Feuerbach, Hegel’s exposition was supposed to have presupposed nothing, to leave no residue, empty & drain us completely
O.linkedContent: acc. Feuerbach, Hegel’s exposition was supposed to have presupposed nothing, to leave no residue, empty & drain us completely

SW.content: letting other live: absolute suicide, no trace, not even the seal of a break
SW.linkedContent: letting other live: absolute suicide, no trace, not even the seal of a break

SW.content: not even leave them my ashes
SW.linkedContent: not even leave them my ashes

SW.content: no longer be oneself or have oneself (s’être ou s’avoir) > truth w/out truth looking for me at end of world
SW.linkedContent: no longer be oneself or have oneself (s’être ou s’avoir) > truth w/out truth looking for me at end of world

SW.content: blessing of one who leaves w/out leaving an address
SW.linkedContent: blessing of one who leaves w/out leaving an address

RGE.content: that there must be meaning, that nothing must be definitely lost in death, that Hegel refers to death as “abstract negativity” > Bataille finds all this laughable
RGE.linkedContent: that there must be meaning, that nothing must be definitely lost in death, that Hegel refers to death as “abstract negativity” > Bataille finds all this laughable

DST.content: abortive: a birth takes place w/out taking place: event of a singular failure, “comes to itself only to lose itself” [re: Lacoue-Labarthe on Reik’s theory of autobiography]
DST.linkedContent: abortive: a birth takes place w/out taking place: event of a singular failure, “comes to itself only to lose itself” [re: Lacoue-Labarthe on Reik’s theory of autobiography]

TR.content: formidable effects of machinelike automaticity: an a priori, programmed “I apologize” > automatic forgiveness self-destructs w/out delay (faster than “Mission Impossible” tapes), loses its meaning, its memory, annihilates its own archive
TR.linkedContent: formidable effects of machinelike automaticity: an a priori, programmed “I apologize” > automatic forgiveness self-destructs w/out delay (faster than “Mission Impossible” tapes), loses its meaning, its memory, annihilates its own archive

TR.content: “I beseech you” not to “annihilate” [re: Confessions]: performative eve, arche-peformative before performative, younger & older, support & archive of confession, its subjectile
TR.linkedContent: “I beseech you” not to “annihilate” [re: Confessions]: performative eve, arche-peformative before performative, younger & older, support & archive of confession, its subjectile

IW.content: history’s harshest reality, its most murderous aspects—displacements of figures?
IW.linkedContent: history’s harshest reality, its most murderous aspects—displacements of figures?

D.content: relation to innumerable, absence of traces—unnameable, relation to my death
D.linkedContent: relation to innumerable, absence of traces—unnameable, relation to my death

ATM.content: to bury a text that erased the name of God [dysgraphy] is not to annihilate it (burn the whole thing): by inhuming the fault, one keeps it; a work of mourning which can either 1) be successful through spiritual interiorization, introjection 2) or else be paralyzed in melancholic pathology (incorporation)
ATM.linkedContent: to bury a text that erased the name of God [dysgraphy] is not to annihilate it (burn the whole thing): by inhuming the fault, one keeps it; a work of mourning which can either 1) be successful through spiritual interiorization, introjection 2) or else be paralyzed in melancholic pathology (incorporation)

CIN.content: the totally incinerated envois could not be indicated by any mark
CIN.linkedContent: the totally incinerated envois could not be indicated by any mark
